fullName.value: Dual specificity mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 3

texts.value: Dual specificity kinase. Is activated by cytokines and environmental stress in vivo. Catalyzes the concomitant phosphorylation of a threonine and a tyrosine residue in the MAP kinase p38. Part of a signaling cascade that begins with the activation of the adrenergic receptor ADRA1B and leads to the activation of MAPK14
Activated by dual phosphorylation on Ser-218 and Thr-222

Component of a signaling complex containing at least AKAP13, PKN1, MAPK14, ZAK and MAP2K3. Within this complex, AKAP13 interacts directly with PKN1, which in turn recruits MAPK14, MAP2K3 and ZAK (PubMed:21224381). Binds to DYRK1B/MIRK and increases its kinase activity (PubMed:11980910). Part of a complex with MAP3K3, RAC1 and CCM2 (By similarity). Interacts with ARRB1 (PubMed:16709866)
Abundant expression is seen in the skeletal muscle. It is also widely expressed in other tissues
Autophosphorylated. Phosphorylation on Ser-218 and Thr-222 by MAP kinase kinase kinases positively regulates the kinase activity (PubMed:8622669). Phosphorylated by TAOK2 (PubMed:11279118)
(Microbial infection) Yersinia YopJ may acetylate Ser/Thr residues, preventing phosphorylation and activation, thus blocking the MAPK signaling pathway
Defects in MAP2K3 may be involved in colon cancer
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. STE Ser/Thr protein kinase family. MAP kinase kinase subfamily

features.description: Dual specificity mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 3

citation.title: Independent human MAP-kinase signal transduction pathways defined by MEK and MKK isoforms.

Purification and identification of a major activator for p38 from osmotically shocked cells: activation of mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 6 by osmotic shock, tumor necrosis factor-alpha, and H2O2.
Complete sequencing and characterization of 21,243 full-length human cDNAs.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
MKK3- and MKK6-regulated gene expression is mediated by the p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase signal transduction pathway.
Regulation of stress-responsive mitogen-activated protein (MAP) kinase pathways by TAO2.
Mirk protein kinase is activated by MKK3 and functions as a transcriptional activator of HNF1alpha.
Platelet-activating factor-induced clathrin-mediated endocytosis requires beta-arrestin-1 recruitment and activation of the p38 MAPK signalosome at the plasma membrane for actin bundle formation.
Yersinia YopJ acetylates and inhibits kinase activation by blocking phosphorylation.
Lys-N and trypsin cover complementary parts of the phosphoproteome in a refined SCX-based approach.
